alert.note: Alert for Hancock; McDonough (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 12:21AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern McDonough, Hancock, southwestern Lee and southeastern Clark Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1221 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Carthage to near St. Francisville. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Keokuk, Carthage, Hamilton, Warsaw, Augusta, Wayland, Bowen, West Point, Alexandria, Ferris, St. Francisville, Winchester, Plymouth, Denver, Elvaston, Basco, Revere, Bentley, Keokuk Airport and Gregory Landing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
